flexsdm 0.0.1
  • Reference

Function to perform environmental filtering of species occurrence records

env_filtering.Rd

Function to perform environmental filtering of species occurrence records

env_filtering(data, x, y, id, variables, nbins, cores = 1)

Arguments

data

data.frame. Data.frame or tibble object with presences (or presence-absence) records, and coordinates
x

character. Column name with longitude data
y

character. Column name with latitude data
id

character. Column names with rows id. It is important that each row has its own unique code.
variables

SpatRaste. Rasters with environmental conditions
nbins

integer. A number of classes used to split each environmental condition
cores

integer. Number of machine cores used for processing in parallel

Value

A tibble object with filtered data

Examples

# \dontrun{
require(terra)
require(dplyr)

# Envirnomental variables
somevar <- system.file("external/somevar.tif", package = "flexsdm")
somevar <- terra::rast(somevar)

plot(somevar)


# Species occurrences
data("spp")
spp

#> # A tibble: 1,150 x 4
#>    species        x        y pr_ab
#>    <chr>      <dbl>    <dbl> <dbl>
#>  1 sp1       -5541. -145138.     0
#>  2 sp1      -51981.   16322.     0
#>  3 sp1     -269871.   69512.     1
#>  4 sp1      -96261.  -32008.     0
#>  5 sp1      269589. -566338.     0
#>  6 sp1       29829. -328468.     0
#>  7 sp1     -152691.  393782.     0
#>  8 sp1     -195081.  253652.     0
#>  9 sp1        -951. -277978.     0
#> 10 sp1      145929. -271498.     0
#> # ... with 1,140 more rows
spp1 <- spp %>% dplyr::filter(species == "sp1", pr_ab == 1)

somevar[[1]] %>% plot()

points(spp1 %>% select(x, y))


spp1$idd <- 1:nrow(spp1)


# 5 bins
filtered_1 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  variables = somevar,
  nbins = 5,
  cores = 1
)

#> Extracting values from raster ... 
#> 38 records were removed because they have NAs for some variables
#> Number of classes in the environmental space: 1296
#> Number of unfiltered records: 212
#> Number of filtered records: 35

# 8 bins
filtered_2 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  variables = somevar,
  nbins = 8,
  cores = 1
)

#> Extracting values from raster ... 
#> 38 records were removed because they have NAs for some variables
#> Number of classes in the environmental space: 6561
#> Number of unfiltered records: 212
#> Number of filtered records: 61

# 12 bins
filtered_3 <- env_filtering(
  data = spp1,
  x = "x",
  y = "y",
  id = "idd",
  variables = somevar,
  nbins = 12,
  cores = 1
)

#> Extracting values from raster ... 
#> 38 records were removed because they have NAs for some variables
#> Number of classes in the environmental space: 28561
#> Number of unfiltered records: 212
#> Number of filtered records: 99
# note that while higher the nbins parameter higher the number of
# classes to be processed (4 variables, 30 bins = 923521 classes)

# While higher the number of bins smaller the number of records retained
# }
